snippet: Doug O’Neill’s Kentucky Derby victory places him — and his troubled record — center stage at a time when thoroughbred racing faces calls for federal regulation.
abstract: Kentucky Derby victory of horse I'll Have Another, which was trained by Doug O'Neill, places O'Neill and his troubled record center stage at a time when thoroughbred racing is facing numerous challenges and calls to better protect horses and riders; O'Neill has received dozens of violations over the years for improper use of drugs on the horses he has trained.

byline.original: By JOE DRAPE and WALT BOGDANICH

lead_paragraph: Doug O’Neill’s Kentucky Derby victory places him — and his troubled record — center stage at a time when thoroughbred racing faces calls for federal regulation.

headline.seo: Trainer of Kentucky Derby Winner Has a Troubled Record
headline.main: A Derby Win, but a Troubled Record for a Trainer
headline.print_headline: Derby Win, but a Troubled Record, for a Trainer
